loginPage.title: Login
loginPage.text: Welcome! You’re about to shape the future of Canadian broadcasting. We use cookies to improve your experience! By continuing, you accept our
loginPage.browserUpdateText: For better user experience please update your browser.
loginPage.userNamePasswordNotMatchText: The username or Password do not match, please try again.

welcomePage.title: Welcome
welcomePage.text: We're happy to have you! You now have the power to shape Canada's broadcasting industry! By taking part in our surveys, you help broadcasters understand the kind of entertainment Canadians care about. Be assured that your
welcomePage.text1: are always protected. We hope you enjoy time with us.
welcomePage.surveyhubText: All surveys organized in one place for you.
welcomePage.techSupportText: We are here to help. Just ask!

messageCenter.title: Messaging Center
messageCenter.description: Welcome to the messaging center where you can access messages and take actions.

techSupportPage.title: Tech Support
techSupportPage.description: Have a question? Run into a problem? No sweat! Try searching the FAQ section for an answer. If that doesn’t work, drop us a line.

faq.title: FAQs
faq.description: Search answers to frequently asked questions.

connectNumeris.title: Connect with Numeris
connectNumeris.description: Drop us a line and we’ll look into it for you.

panelistRegistration.title: Ready? Let’s create your account.
panelistRegistration.description: Please enter the one-time password (OTP) we emailed you.

surveyHub.title: Survey Hub
surveyHub.description: Welcome to Survey Hub! Here, you'll find surveys that are quick and easy. We ask only basic questions to understand the type of entertainment programs you enjoy, and the device you prefer watching them on. Be assured that your

houseHold.title: Household
houseHold.description: This section collects basic information about household members and the media devices they use.
houseHold.devicesCardDescription: Surveys about media devices you have at home.
houseHold.demographicCardDescription: Basic questions about members in your household.
houseHold.televisionCardDescription: Surveys about your cable and antena television usage.

accountSettings.title: Account settings
accountSettings.description: Use your account settings to change your password, adjust your email notifications, or learn about our Privacy Policy.
accountSettings.emailNotificationsDescription: Choose the type of emails you want to receive.
accountSettings.privacyPolicyDescription: Protecting your privacy is our top priority.

householdDevices.title: Household Devices
householdDevices.description: This section shows surveys for all media devices connected to your home internet.
householdDevices.newDescription: New shows surveys for devices that were newly added to your home network. We recommend you start with these surveys.
householdDevices.progressDescription: In Progress shows device surveys you began but are still to complete.
householdDevices.historyDescription: Completed devices show surveys that you have completed. You can review, change and resubmit any of these surveys. Devices that are not in use shows surveys for devices you marked not in use. If you ever put them to use again, please tap to update their status.

faqPage.description1: Have a question? Browse through the most frequently asked questions below.
faqPage.title2: I did not find my answer
faqPage.text2: and we will be glad to assist you!

helpNumeris.title: Connect with Numeris
helpNumeris.description: Problem with your account? Something not right? Use this form to tell us more about the issue. Within 1 business day, our team will reply to the email you’ve registered with us.
helpNumeris.heading: How can we help?
helpNumeris.subject: Subject (E.g. Cant’ change my password)
helpNumeris.description1: Give us some more details about the issue you’re facing.

contactUs.title: Contact Us
contactUs.description: Send us a message or call us at our Montreal or Richmond office locations.
contactUs.heading: Send us a message
contactUs.description1: Just send us a message below with any questions you have, and we will get back to you.
contactUs.subject: Subject
contactUs.montrealDescription: For panelist in ON, QC and Atlantic region - Eastern time
contactUs.richmondDescription: For panelist in MB, SK, AB and BC - Pacific time

forgotPassword.title: Forgot password
forgotPassword.description: We will send you an email with instructions on how to reset your password.
forgotPassword.passwordRequest: Your request for password rest has been initiated.
forgotPassword.passwordReqBody: Please check your email for link to reset your password.
forgotPassword.passwordUpdatedDescription: You're good to go! Please login when you are ready.

newAccount.title: Ready ? Let`s create your account.
newAccount.description: Please enter the one-time password(OTP) we emailed you.
newAccount.keyRequiredText: Key must be at least 6 characters

newDevices.title: New Devices
newDevices.description: This page shows all media devices that are New connected to your home network. Surveys in this section will ask you basic questions about each device’s use. Be assured that your privacy policy.
newDevices.devicesDetectedDescription: Select a device to start a survey.

inProgressDevices.title: In Progress Devices
inProgressDevices.description: This page lists surveys for media devices that you started but are yet to complete. Each survey has basic questions about a device’s usage. Select a device to complete its survey.

completedDevices.title: Completed
completedDevices.description: This page shows media devices for which you’ve completed surveys. Nice going! You can review, edit and resubmit a completed survey.
completedDevices.description2: You are about to edit a survey that you completed earlier for the device above. Please select the section that you’d like to edit from the list below.

notInUse.description: This page shows media devices that you marked as “not in use”. If you’re using them again, please update its status by selecting a card below.

deviceOwner.title: Device Owner Information
deviceOwner.description: Please select the name of the household member who owns this device.
deviceOwner.error: Please select device owner from the list

multipleUsers.title: Multiple Users
multipleUsers.description1: In this section, we wish to understand the approximate share (expressed in percentages) each household member has in watching this TV every month.
multipleUsers.description2: Let’s consider an example. Three household members – a parent and 2 children – share a Smart TV. So, their shared device usage can be entered as: Parent=30%, Child 1 = 50%, Child 2 = 20%.
multipleUsers.heading: Shared device usage
multipleUsers.text1: Select how long each household member uses this device
multipleUsers.tip1: Enter an approximate percentage value for each member.
multipleUsers.tip2: If a member hasn’t viewed the device at all in the past month, enter 0% against their name.
multipleUsers.tip3: The total for all members should add up to 100.
multipleUsers.text2: Select how long this device is used by single vs multiple member at one time

deviceUsage.title: Device Usage
deviceUsage.description: This section has surveys that help us understand the media genres that each household member watches on this Smart TV.
deviceUsage.tip1: This survey lists 13 genres in all. Choose all that apply.
deviceUsage.tip2: You may complete the surveys in any order you wish.
deviceUsage.heading: Household member list
deviceUsage.text: Select the survey under your name. You may also select and complete a survey on behalf of a household member. Only after the status for ALL members shows “COMPLETE”, tap the SUMBIT button to continue.

genres.description: Let’s get a bit specific about the genres watched online by.
genres.heading: List view of
genres.text2: watches online, and the time of day they most likely watch them at. You may select multiple time options
genres.message: You have successfully submitted information to us.
genres.error: At least one check box should be selected.

changePassword.title: Change Password
changePassword.tip1: Your password must be between 8 and 20 characters long
changePassword.tip2: Have one upper and one lower case letter
changePassword.tip3: It must have both letters and numbers and not have spaces or emojis
changePassword.passwordValidationMessage: Password should contain minimum 8 characters, at least 1 uppercase letter, 1 lowercase letter and 1 number
changePassword.passwordMatchText: Password and Confirm Password must match.

emailNotifications.title: Email Notifications
emailNotifications.description: Choose the type of emails you’d like to receive from us.
emailNotifications.heading: Select your preferences below
emailNotifications.q1: Keep me informed about new features and company-related news.
emailNotifications.q2: I’d like to receive promotional and special offers.
emailNotifications.q3: Notify me each time there’s a login into my account.

thankYouTechSupport.title: Thank you
thankYouTechSupport.description: Great! We received your note. We will email you our reply within 1 business day.
thankYouTechSupport.heading: Ask another question
thankYouTechSupport.text1: Looking to ask more questions? No worries,  we are here for you!
thankYouTechSupport.text3: We have saved the incomplete survey in the
thankYouTechSupport.text4: section. You can always go back to it and complete it later.

thankYou.title: Thank you
thankYou.text1: We have saved your survey in the

faqPageVam.q1: I accidentally unplugged the FocalMeter. What should I do?
faqPageVam.q2: Do I need to keep my router and the FocalMeter plugged in overnight?
faqPageVam.q3: How much of my data plan will the FocalMeter use?
faqPageVam.q4: How much does it cost in electricity to run the FocalMeter?
faqPageVam.q5: If I change my internet or TV providers or change the devices in my household, do I need to tell you?
faqPageVam.q6: What do the different lights on the FocalMeter mean?
faqPageVam.q7: How do I reboot the FocalMeter if the light is not a Solid Green Colour?
faqPageVam.q8: How do I uninstall the FocalMeter?
faqPageVam.q9: How do I return the equipment?

faqPageVamAnswers.a1: Don't worry, just plug it back in! When you see a solid green light, you know it's working. If you don't see a solid green light, please contact us via the contact information on the back of this guide.
faqPageVamAnswers.a2: Yes, please. Leave your router and the FocalMeter plugged in all the time, including overnight and when you are away from home. This allows the FocalMeter to share the data properly. Also, because our systems will notify us if it sees a problem with the meter, you won`t receive a phone call from us to troubleshoot the problem.
faqPageVamAnswers.a3: The FocalMeter uses a small amount of data, less than 5MB per day.
faqPageVamAnswers.a4: The cost is minimal. Each meter uses about 4 watts which translates to just a few pennies per day.
faqPageVamAnswers.a5: Yes, please let us know if there are any changes to your providers, router, or any of the devices in your household.
faqPageVamAnswers.a6: Solid Green: The FocalMeter is working correctly. Flashing red: If you recently changed your WiFi router and see a flashing red light on the meter, please contact us to provide the model of your new router so that we can approve the connection. Solid red: The FocalMeter is having technical issues. Please contact us using the information on the back of this guide. Any other colour (solid or flashing): There may be a technical problem with your meter, please contact us via the contact information on the back of this guide.
faqPageVamAnswers.a7: If you notice a problem with the FocalMeter, or if you see that the solid green light has disappeared, simply disconnect the power cord, wait 30 seconds and reconnect the power cord. Then, send a short email to regional Panel Administration team. They will make sure the FocalMeter is still working properly. You won't need to register again.
faqPageVamAnswers.a8: To uninstall the FocalMeter, first notify the Panel Administration team that you would like to uninstall the FocalMeter. Next, unplug the network cable and the power cord.
faqPageVamAnswers.a9: Pack up the FocalMeter, network cable, and power cord in the original box and ensure that the return waybill is affixed to the outside of the box. You can then either drop it off yourself at any Purolator location or Staples store, or we can schedule Purolator to come directly to your home and pick up the package. Please notify us by phone or email that you are returning the equipment and/or if you would like us to schedule a pick up.

registrationForm.tip3: Have one upper and one lower case letter
registrationForm.tip4: Not  have spaces, special characters or emojis
registrationForm.passwordError: Password should have minimum 8 characters, at least 1 uppercase letter, 1 lowercase letter and 1 number

registerSuccess.description1: We are thrilled to have you! For your records, we have emailed you a details.
registerSuccess.description3: You’re good to go! Please login when ready.

passwordReset.tip3: Have one upper and one lower case letter
passwordReset.tip4: Not  have spaces, special characters or emojis
passwordReset.passwordValidation: Password should have minimum 8 characters, at least 1 uppercase letter, 1 lowercase letter and 1 number
passwordReset.passwotdNotMatchText: Password and Confirm Password must match.

deviceInformation.description: Let’s talk a bit about your
deviceInformation.descriptionPart2: It helps us understand how it's being used.
deviceInformation.descriptionPart3: Be assured that your privacy is our top concern and we check your device for specific data only.
deviceInformation.heading: Device Information
deviceInformation.description2: Naming this device makes it easy for you to identify it in the future. Your focal meter says this device is called “Yoda”. Continue using this name or enter a different one below.
deviceInformation.q1: How many household members use this device?
deviceInformation.q1Option5: This device is no longer in use
deviceInformation.success: Thank you, your progress has been saved, see you later.
deviceInformation.success2: You have successfully submitted information to us.
deviceInformation.resubmit: Thank you for updating your information!
deviceInformation.error: Please choose one of the options.

faqSSPQuestions.q1: What is the Numeris Multimedia Ratings Panel?
faqSSPQuestions.q3: What do panel members receive for being a part of the ratings panel?
faqSSPQuestions.q5: Do I have to listen to the radio or watch TV or online videos to be eligible for monthly rewards or draws?
faqSSPQuestions.q6: Do I have to report the incentives or draw winnings that I receive from Numeris in my annual taxes to the government?
faqSSPQuestions.q7: Why do we need complete questionnaires?
faqSSPQuestions.q8: Why do I have to sign the Consent and Confidentiality Agreement?
faqSSPQuestions.q9: What household or technology changes do we need to inform you of,  and why?
faqSSPQuestions.q10: What if we take a vacation or travel?
faqSSPQuestions.q11: Can I plug in my Meters as soon as I receive them?
faqSSPQuestions.q12: What are the beacons meant for and do they need to remain plugged in?
faqSSPQuestions.q13: Why do I need to let you know when I am changing addresses?
faqSSPQuestions.q14: What if someone in the family listens to radio or watches TV using headphones?
faqSSPQuestions.q15: Do I need to charge my PersonalMeter every night?
faqSSPQuestions.q16: Do I have to carry the PersonalMeter in the summer months and during the holiday season?
faqSSPQuestions.q17: I have a large family and it is hard to keep track of the PersonalMeters.  Can you provide some tips?
faqSSPQuestions.q18: How do I make carrying the PersonalMeters fun and easy to remember for the family?
faqSSPQuestions.q19: What do I do if I lose my Meter or if it doesn’t work anymore?
faqSSPQuestions.q20: Am I the only person allowed to wear my PersonalMeter?
faqSSPQuestions.q21: Will the time on my PersonalMeter automatically adjust to daylight saving time?
faqSSPQuestions.q22: How does the FocalMeter exclude web traffic that is not on the Inclusion list?
faqSSPQuestions.q23: Will someone need to visit my home to hook up the equipment?
faqSSPQuestions.q24: Do I need to push any buttons on my Meters, or do anything special, to participate?
faqSSPQuestions.q25: How long do the PersonalMeter and FocalMeter installations take?
faqSSPQuestions.q26: Will the FocalMeter interfere with my Internet service or other networked devices?
faqSSPQuestions.q28: How did you get my name and telephone number?
faqSSPQuestions.q29: How will my Panel Administrator contact me?
faqSSPQuestions.q30: Once I have joined, how long do I stay on the panel?
faqSSPQuestions.q31: What should I tell people that ask about my FocalMeter or PersonalMeter?
faqSSPQuestions.q32: What do the indicator lights on my PersonalMeter mean?
faqSSPQuestions.q33: What do the messages on my PersonalMeter mean?
faqSSPQuestions.q34: What are the Numeris office hours and how do I contact Numeris?

faqSSPAnswers.a1: The Numeris Multimedia Ratings Panel consists of many types of households across Canada, such as yours. Each household has been carefully selected to represent the region in which they live.  These households provide important information about radio listening and television and video viewing. Numeris uses this information to create what are often called ratings. Broadcasters use the ratings to make important decisions about programming.  By participating in the panel, Canadians can let broadcasters know which programs they enjoy online, on TV and on the radio.
faqSSPAnswers.a2.1: Two types of equipment are used in the panel: The FocalMeter and the PersonalMeter. Each one measures different types of programming.
faqSSPAnswers.a2.2: The FocalMeter is a small box that connects to your internet router. It detects only a specific set of websites or streaming services that are used to watch TV online. You can find the list of websites it measures at
faqSSPAnswers.a2.3: Each member of your household will be given their own PersonalMeter to keep with them. It picks up a silent broadcast signal that tells us the radio stations that they are listening to and the television programs that they are watching. Since the PersonalMeter uses cellular technology, please call us right away if you have been advised by a medical professional not to use a cellular telephone.
faqSSPAnswers.a2.4: The information from the Meters is combined with the information from other panel  households to produce the ratings.
faqSSPAnswers.a3.1: As a token of appreciation, each panelist will receive a cash reward every month, for the previous month’s participation. Panelists receive $1.25 per week for participating in the ratings panel, and a bonus amount for each week that they earn enough reward points from carrying the PersonalMeter (500 points or more for ages 12 and above, and 300 points or more for children aged 11 and under).
faqSSPAnswers.a3.2: Panelists are also eligible for gift cards that are sent annually as well as weekly, monthly and special draws.
faqSSPAnswers.a4: Numeris holds regional draws every week and month with each prize valued at $100. For weekly draws, a date is randomly selected and a winner is also randomly selected from all panelists who accumulated at least 50 reward points for that day. For monthly draws, only panelists who accumulate 60 reward points every Saturday and Sunday of the month are eligible. We also hold draws on the following holidays: Family day, Easter, Victoria Day, St-Jean, Canada Day, Civic holiday, Labor Day, Thanks Giving, Remembrance Day, the Winter Holiday Season and we also have monthly Summer draws.
faqSSPAnswers.a5: Regardless of the amount of radio and video you consume, as long as you’re carrying your PersonalMeter with you and your FocalMeter is plugged in, you’re eligible for draws and will receive your monthly rewards. Watching or listening more will not increase your rewards.
faqSSPAnswers.a6: The monthly incentives that you receive, or draws that you may win, are gifts to you for participating in the panel.  You do not have to report them in your taxes.
faqSSPAnswers.a7: Numeris asks all panelists to complete a set of questionnaires when they first join the panel, and at every yearly anniversary. Since we only report on groups of people, and never on individuals, this information helps us to group each panelist correctly. It also helps improve the quality of the ratings we produce. We realize they take time to answer, but they are a very important part of the ratings data. Kindly complete your questionnaires in a timely manner. If you need assistance, please give us a call and we will be happy to help you.
faqSSPAnswers.a8: All Numeris panelists are asked to sign the Consent and Confidentiality Agreements This document outlines the commitments of both Numeris and panelists with respect to confidentiality. We at Numeris are committed to maintaining the privacy and anonymity of our panelists. We want to ensure that you are fully aware of the information that we are gathering and how it is being used. We also expect that you will keep your participation in the panel confidential and not reveal your identity to any radio or television broadcasters, or media or advertising agencies; including via social networking. These steps are very important to protect your information as well as the quality of the ratings that we produce.
faqSSPAnswers.a9.1: It is very important for us to know about changes to any of the following, so that we can accurately collect and report your viewing and listening preferences to broadcasters. This is so important to us that we will send you a token of appreciation when you notify us of these changes.
faqSSPAnswers.a9.3: If you change your TV or internet service, and any of the following are applicable to you, give us a call:
faqSSPAnswers.a9.4: You currently use an antenna for TV service (rabbit ears with no cable or satellite TV subscriptions), and decide to sign on with a cable or satellite provider;
faqSSPAnswers.a9.5: You already subscribe to cable TV, but change the type of service you receive (analog cable to digital cable, digital cable to analog cable, or from cable to antenna or satellite);
faqSSPAnswers.a9.6: You currently subscribe to satellite TV, but change the type of service you receive (you get cable, or move to antenna only).
faqSSPAnswers.a9.7: If you cancel all TV reception.
faqSSPAnswers.a9.8: If you are change your internet provider, internet service or cancel your internet service completely.
faqSSPAnswers.a9.9: Please note that it’s not necessary to contact us if you get additional digital cable or satellite receivers, you keep the same type of reception but change providers, or you change the number of channels to which you subscribe.
faqSSPAnswers.a9.11: Please let us know if your household gains or loses a member. That is, if someone moves in or out, a baby is born, or someone passes away.
faqSSPAnswers.a9.13: Please let us know if you purchase or rent a PVR. If you already have a PVR and get additional ones, it is not necessary to inform us.
faqSSPAnswers.a9.15: Please let us know if you add or remove devices from your household. These include TV sets, computers and mobile devices.
faqSSPAnswers.a10: If you are planning to be away from your home for any reason, let your Panel Administrator know when you're leaving and when you'll be back.
faqSSPAnswers.a11: When receiving new equipment, please allow it to come to room temperature before plugging it in, ideally for 24 hours.
faqSSPAnswers.a12: Panel households should have two beacons installed at all times, with the light on. They should also be as far apart from each other as possible, or on different floors. These beacons transmit a silent signal detected by your PersonalMeter when it is within your house and allows us to accurately know when your media consumption is within your home or outside of your home. Please leave the beacons installed at all times, and let us know if the light ever goes out, or if you do not have two of them.
faqSSPAnswers.a13: If you’re moving into a new home, please don’t forget to advise Numeris as soon as you know the new address (and phone number, if applicable) so we have the most current information on file.
faqSSPAnswers.a14: Your PersonalMeter cannot pick up the codes if you use headphones or earbuds with your television, radio, computer or other device. Please use the provided headphone adapter and all your tuning will be included in the ratings. If you do not have the adapter, please contact us so we can send you one. Please note the headphone adapters may not be compatible with all devices.
faqSSPAnswers.a15: Charging your PersonalMeter with the provided charger at night is just as important as wearing your Meter during the day. This will provide enough time for your Meter's battery to fully recharge and last throughout the day. It will mean that your Meter is always able to transfer your data to Numeris, capture your media exposure and collect your points. So please remember to charge your Meter every night!
faqSSPAnswers.a16: Yes, being part of the panel requires that you carry your PersonalMeter all year round. We realize normal habits change during the summer months and the holiday season. It is very important for you to carry your PersonalMeter all year round because Numeris produces the ratings all year round. As usual, please let us know if you go away on vacation by calling us or emailing us. Also, please remember that we have special holiday season draws for December and January, and monthly summer draws in June, July and August. If you would like some tips on ways to help you carry the PersonalMeter every day, please give us a call and our panel administration staff will provide guidance.
faqSSPAnswers.a17: Some large households have found that charging all the PersonalMeters in one central spot in the home, and finding a unique way to identify each person’s PersonalMeter helpful. Panelists have used different coloured Post-Its with special messages to help family members easily identify their PersonalMeter each day.
faqSSPAnswers.a18: Turn it into a game! Adding a competitive element to wearing the PersonalMeter can change the whole dynamic. Suddenly, it is not just remembering the PersonalMeter in the morning and charging it at night. It’s about WINNING!
faqSSPAnswers.a19: Let us know if you have misplaced your PersonalMeter in or around your home. We may be able to use the Meter finder feature to make it beep, to help you find it. Please let us know right away, as we cannot use this feature if we have lost your PersonalMeter’s signal. Also, let us know as soon as possible, if you do not know where the Meter is lost or if it is damaged, so we can replace it. You are not responsible for any loss or damage. Please note the metering equipment you have in your home belongs to Numeris and we reserve the right to ask for its return at our discretion.
faqSSPAnswers.a20: Yes, you are the only person allowed to wear your PersonalMeter. Everybody must wear their own Meter.  Otherwise, it falsifies the data and can result in your removal from the panel.
faqSSPAnswers.a21: Yes, the PersonalMeter will display the correct time when it is daylight saving time.
faqSSPAnswers.a22.1: The FocalMeter ONLY tracks web traffic based on a pre-determined inclusion list
faqSSPAnswers.a22.2: The inclusion list is a list of approved websites where the FocalMeter is allowed to monitor video viewing. Any website not on the inclusion list will not have any data logged by the FocalMeter. It DOES NOT monitor any secure traffic on your network, or any traffic on banking or e-commerce sites. It does not track any passwords or monitor any emails or IM chats.
faqSSPAnswers.a22.3: Even on inclusion list sites, the FocalMeter only monitors a small fraction of content from these sites via tags. Tags are specific URLs identifying the pages navigated or the videos played within an inclusion list website. Apart from this, the FocalMeter collects the Mac Address of the home router and information on the local home network, Model, Name, OS, MAC Address and local IP address of devices seen in the home network.
faqSSPAnswers.a23: No. We have enclosed complete instructions when we sent you your equipment. We will also enclose a telephone number you can call if you need help. Our Panel Administration Team can assist you over the phone with your installation.
faqSSPAnswers.a24.1: Using your Meters is very easy. All you need to do is connect your FocalMeter to your home Internet connection. Then, follow the online registration process to register your FocalMeter with our panel. That’s all that is required and there are no buttons to push.
faqSSPAnswers.a24.2: The PersonalMeter must be with you all day but there are no buttons to push or anything special that is needed. There may be places where you need to turn off the cellular system in your PersonalMeter the same way you would for your cellular phone, such as on an airplane or in a hospital. It is important to keep your PersonalMeter with you during these times so that you continue to earn points. The button located on the front of your PersonalMeter has two functions: it activates the display’s backlight, and it can be used to turn the PersonalMeter’s cellular system on and off. To turn off the PersonalMeter’s internal cellular system, hold down the button on the front of the PersonalMeter for about 5 seconds until the symbol appears on the display screen. This symbol means that the cellular system is turned off. To turn the cellular system back on, simply hold the button down again for a few seconds until the symbol no longer appears on the display screen. In order to include your radio listening and TV viewing in the ratings, please make sure that you turn your PersonalMeter back on as soon as you are able to do so.
faqSSPAnswers.a25: Connecting the FocalMeter to your network will take less than 10 minutes. After connecting the network cable between your FocalMeter and home router and powering the FocalMeter, there is an online device registration process. The PersonalMeters only take a few minutes to install and including plugging in the PersonalMeters and the beacons.
faqSSPAnswers.a26: No, in most cases the equipment will not interfere with your Internet service or other devices in any way. In rare cases, panelists have experienced intermittent connectivity issues with some networked devices. If you experience any technical issues, please unplug the FocalMeter and contact your Panel Administration Team.
faqSSPAnswers.a27: Recently, you completed a telephone survey with Numeris. Based on the information you gave us, your household was chosen to represent similar households in your area. Your participation in our panel is very important and it will help ensure that our ratings reflect the opinions of all Canadians.
faqSSPAnswers.a28: We obtain contact information in two ways. The phone numbers, names and address details we use are randomly selected from telephone book listings, including cell phone listings. In addition, we use a computer program to randomly generate new numbers in order to reach unlisted phone numbers.
faqSSPAnswers.a29: Your Panel Administrator will contact you by telephone, email or text.
faqSSPAnswers.a30: While we would like you to remain on our panel for an extended period, you may leave whenever you wish. In some situations, due to our panel needs, we may remove households from the panel. Please keep the box that your equipment arrived in so that you can ship it back to us. If you wish to leave the panel, please contact your Panel Administration Team.
faqSSPAnswers.a31: To ensure the integrity of Numeris ratings, it is important that your participation remain confidential. If someone asks about your FocalMeter or PersonalMeter, simply let them know that you are participating in a special research study. Please do not tell anyone you do not know, or anyone working in the media industry, that your household participates in the Numeris panel.
faqSSPAnswers.a32: The indicator light on the top of your PersonalMeter tells you when you are earning points. When you wear your PersonalMeter, the indicator light will stay on. If you put your PersonalMeter down, the light will turn off after a short while. If you do not pick up or move your PersonalMeter, the light will start flashing and then turn off. The light will come back on when you wear or pick up your PersonalMeter.
faqSSPAnswers.a33: Your PersonalMeter has a display screen to tell you about your points and give you information about the Meter. When you are wearing your PersonalMeter, the display will show your name and the time. When you charge your PersonalMeter, the display will show a series of messages once.
faqSSPAnswers.a33.2: Below is a list of some basic messages and what they mean:
faqSSPAnswers.m6: Symbol of a cell phone with a line across it:
faqSSPAnswers.m1Means: The Meter recognizes that it is recharging.
faqSSPAnswers.m2Means: The Meter is adding up the points you have earned by wearing it.
faqSSPAnswers.m3Means: This is the total number of points you have earned so far today and the number of points you earned on the previous day.
faqSSPAnswers.m4Means: This is the number of points you have earned so far this week and how many points you earned last week.
faqSSPAnswers.m5Means: The Meter’s battery needs to be charged for a minimum of 4 hours as soon as possible.
faqSSPAnswers.m6Means: To turn the cellular system back on, please hold down the button on the front of the Meter for a few seconds until this symbol is no longer displayed on the screen.
faqSSPAnswers.text: Your Meter may also display one of the following messages while you are wearing it.
faqSSPAnswers.montrealoffice: Montreal Office (for panelists in ON, QC and Atlantic region-Eastern Time):
faqSSPAnswers.mtf: Monday to Friday: 10:00 am to 6:00 pm
faqSSPAnswers.richmondOffice: Richmond Office (for panelists in MB, SK, AB and BC—Pacific Time):
faqSSPAnswers.rmtf: Monday to Friday: 9:00 am to 6:00 pm

modalWindow.content: Don't have time to submit your survey? No worries, you can come back later and continue from where you left
modalWindow.confirmationDescription: Are you sure you want to leave this page?
modalWindow.errorMSg: membership type could not be determined, please contact the system administrator.

televisionMembers.description: This section has surveys for each household members who viewing channels on a TV set connected to a cable box, satellite or antenna.
televisionMembers.subDescription: Complete the survey that has your name. You may also fill a survey on behalf of another household member.

televisionChannels.description: Please indicate how much time the household member spends watching TV programs using cableor antenna on each of the following TV channels on an average day?.
televisionChannels.heading: List view of 7 channels
televisionChannels.subText: Select answers for each channel below
televisionChannels.option3: More than 30 minutes up to 1 hour
televisionChannels.option4: More than 1 hour up to 2 hours
televisionChannels.option5: More than 2 hours up to 3 hours

demographics.description1: Surveys in this section ask basic questions about household members and how they consume media on devices. Be assured that your
demographics.card1Description: Survey for each member in your household.
demographics.card2Description: Survey for the head of the house.
demographics.individualDescription: This section has surveys for each household member. It has 32 basic questions related to name, age, languages spoken, education and occupation – including some behavioural questions. Each survey takes 10 to 15 minutes to complete.
demographics.individualSubDescription: Complete the survey that has your name. You may also fill a survey on behalf of another household member.
demographics.questinarieDescription: Let’s quickly review! To change something, use the BACK button below to go back and change it. If everything looks ok, select CONTINUE.

select-channels.heading1: Please indicate which TV channels below
select-channels.text: Please select all the TV channels
